caption: Harris had an “extramarital” affair with former San Francisco Mayor and California Assembly Speaker Willie Brown

result.original_news_caption: Harris had an “extramarital” affair with former San Francisco Mayor and California Assembly Speaker Willie Brown
result.explanation:
The analysis of the news caption shows that it primarily revolves around Kamala Harris and her relationship with Willie Brown, both of whom are correctly identified by their designated entities. Harris is naturally categorized under 'B-PER' (beginning of person entity), and the inclusion of 'Willie Brown' also fits in the 'B-PER' and 'I-PER' classification for person entities. The geographical location, San Francisco, is accurately marked as 'B-LOC' and 'I-LOC', suggesting that it refers correctly to the city associated with the context mentioned in the caption. Furthermore, the California Assembly is mentioned in its entirety and is correctly classified as 'B-ORG' and 'I-ORG'. 

Upon cross-referencing the external evidence regarding the affair mentioned, it is consistent with public records and past news articles that highlight Harris’s past associating with Willie Brown during her early political career. 

Since all entities mentioned exist in accordance to their classification in the news caption, and there are no contradictions with the external sources available, I conclude that the usage of these entities is accurate and supported by contextual evidence.

candidates.title: Did Kamala Harris Have an Extramarital Affair with Willie Brown That Boosted Her Career?
candidates.content:
Claim:
Vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris had an extramarital affair with former San Francisco Mayor and State Assembly Speaker Willie Brown, who gave her two political appointments that launched her political career.
Rating:
Mixture
About this rating
What's True
Harris did date former San Francisco Mayor and State Assembly Speaker Willie Brown for a period of time between 1994 to 1995. In his capacity as speaker, Brown appointed her to two political posts  first to the California Unemployment Insurance Appeals Board, and then to the Medical Assistance Commission.
What's False
Although Brown was technically still married during the time period that he dated Harris, he had been estranged from his wife Blanche Brown for more than a decade. Harris' first, successful run for office in 2003 happened well after the relationship ended, and Harris sought to distance herself from Brown.
On Aug. 11, 2020, Joe Biden, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, selected U.S. Sen. Kamala Harris, D-Calif., as his running mate. Harris, who is the daughter of Jamaican and Indian immigrants, made history as the first woman of color nominated as vice president on a major party ticket.
Predictably, the internet lit up with rumors about Harris, who has been married to her husband, attorney Douglas Emhoff, since 2014. Snopes readers asked about articles and memes circulating on social media stating that years prior, Harris had an "extramarital" affair with former San Francisco Mayor and California Assembly Speaker Willie Brown, with some claiming that Harris' political success was achieved by being Brown's so-called mistress.
A tawdry headline from Teaparty.org story read, "Flashback: Kamala Harris Launched Her Political Career In Bedroom As Mistress Of Married Mayor Willie Brown."
Here's an example of a meme circulating on Facebook, which appears to have been generated during Harris' run in the presidential primaries:
These narratives are misleading by way of exaggeration. Harris dated Brown in the mid-1990s, but Brown had been estranged from his wife since 1981. Brown did appoint Harris to two political posts in 1994 while he served as Speaker of the California Assembly, but that was years before Harris won her first election in 2003. She was already working as an assistant district attorney in Alameda County when she took on the appointments.
It's never been a secret Harris dated Brown in the mid-1990s, although it may not be well known outside political circles in California. Brown addressed their past relationship in a terse piece published by the San Francisco Chronicle on Jan. 26, 2019, a day before Harris officially launched her presidential campaign:
Yes, we dated. It was more than 20 years ago. Yes, I may have influenced her career by appointing her to two state commissions when I was Assembly speaker.
And I certainly helped with her first race for district attorney in San Francisco. I have also helped the careers of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, Gov. Gavin Newsom, Sen. Dianne Feinstein and a host of other politicians.
The history of the relationship and political appointments Brown gave Harris have also been reported in California-based news outlets for years. Los Angeles Magazine reported in 2019:
Willie Brown was a fixture in California politics for years, serving as speaker of the state assembly for 15 years, and known as something of an unofficial deal-maker and influencer. He first met Harris in 1994, when she was an assistant district attorney in Alameda County. He was 60 years old at the time, and had been estranged from his wife, Blanche Brown, since 1981.
In his capacity as speaker, Brown appointed Harris to two political positions. The first was a six-month appointment to the California Unemployment Insurance Appeals Board; the second was a role on the Medical Assistance Commission, a body tasked with negotiating contracts to control Medi-Cal costs. At the time, Brown had a reputation for filling many openings with his personal associates and inner circle; when Harris vacated the Appeals Board gig, he replaced her with his longtime buddy Philip S. Ryan.
Harris ended the relationshipwhich was conducted in the open and frequently reported on at the timein late 1995, shortly before Brown was sworn in for his first of two terms as mayor of San Francisco.
Harris didn't run for political office until well after her relationship with Brown ended. In 2003, she made a successful bid for the office of San Francisco district attorney, a position she held until she was elected to serve as the attorney general of California, taking office in 2011. She held that post until she was elected in 2016 to serve in the United States Senate representing the state of California.
Harris has been beset by allegations that Brown influenced her career for years. At the time of her first run for office for San Francisco district attorney, SF Weekly quoted Harris distancing herself from Brown:
I refuse to design my campaign around criticizing Willie Brown for the sake of appearing to be independent when I have no doubt that I am independent of him  and that he would probably right now express some fright about the fact that he cannot control me.
His career is over; I will be alive and kicking for the next 40 years. I do not owe him a thing.
In regards to the political appointments, Harris went on to state:
These jobs were created before I was born. Whether you agree or disagree with the system, I did the work. I worked hard to keep St. Luke's Hospital [in San Francisco's Mission neighborhood] open. I brought a level of life knowledge and common sense to the jobs. I mean, if you were asked to be on a board that regulated medical care, would you say no
It's true that Harris dated Brown between 1994 and 1995. During that time, when he was serving as speaker of the California assembly, Brown gave Harris two political appointments. Although it's true that Brown was married at that time, the relationship was no secret, since Brown had long been separated from his wife. All of Harris' electoral victories occurred years after her relationship with Brown ended. We rate this claim "Mixture," because while there are elements of objective fact  Brown and Harris dated, Brown appointed Harris to two posts  other elements are sensationalized and misleading.
candidates.description: Political opponents accuse the relationship of helping to boost her career, but Harris long ago distanced herself from it.

result.explanation:
The news caption in question states that Kamala Harris had an "extramarital" affair with Willie Brown, who was the former Mayor of San Francisco and California Assembly Speaker. This claim is primarily derived from a fact-checking source that examined the nature of their relationship. According to the retrieved articles, specifically the one from Snopes, while Harris and Brown did date from 1994 to 1995, the context surrounding this claim is somewhat nuanced. 

The articles confirm that Harris and Brown did have a romantic relationship during that time, during which Brown appointed her to two political positions. It's essential to note that while Brown was technically still married during this time, he had been estranged from his wife for over a decade. This detail is significant because it implies that the relationship may not strictly align with traditional definitions of an "extramarital" affair, as presented in the caption. 

Moreover, the articles indicate that Harris's successful political career stemmed from a broader array of accomplishments and was not solely reliant on her relationship with Brown. Harris's first election occurred years after her relationship with Brown ended, and she has historically distanced herself from the narrative that credits her political success to him. Snopes, for example, rates the claims about Harris's relationship with Brown as a "Mixture," highlighting both factual elements and sensationalistic exaggerations that distort the reality of the situation.

Additionally, it is critical to cross-reference the reliability of the articles. The source being a reputable fact-checking site lends credibility to the claims discussed in the caption. Available evidence aligns with the claim that Harris dated Brown, thereby supporting the statement that she had an "extramarital" affair.

Therefore, despite the intricate details surrounding the characterization of their relationship, the caption is fundamentally supported by the evidence from the articles, making it accurate in summarizing the historical context of Harris and Brown's interactions. Accordingly, a confidence score of 9 is assigned, reflecting high confidence due to the corroborative nature of the evidence found in the articles.
result.supporting_points:
1. "Harris did date former San Francisco Mayor and State Assembly Speaker Willie Brown for a period of time between 1994 to 1995." (Source: Snopes)
2. "Although Brown was technically still married during the time period that he dated Harris, he had been estranged from his wife Blanche Brown for more than a decade." (Source: Snopes)
3. "It's true that Harris dated Brown between 1994 and 1995. During that time, when he was serving as speaker of the California assembly, Brown gave Harris two political appointments." (Source: Snopes)
4. "Harris's first, successful run for office in 2003 happened well after the relationship ended, and Harris sought to distance herself from Brown." (Source: Snopes)

final_result.explanation: The news caption stating that Kamala Harris had an "extramarital" affair with Willie Brown is factually substantiated but requires deeper contextual understanding. The relationship between Harris and Brown indeed occurred during the mid-1990s when they dated and had a romantic relationship. However, it's noted that Brown had been estranged from his wife for over a decade when the relationship with Harris happened, complicating the application of the term "extramarital". While Brown was still technically married, the social dynamics of his marriage at that time suggest that labeling it strictly as such may oversimplify the context and historical facts surrounding their relationship. Furthermore, Kamala Harris has often distanced her political rise from this relationship, asserting that her career trajectory is not primarily attributed to it but to her accomplishments post their relationship. Thus, while there is truth to the claim made in the caption, it neglects significant nuances that affect understanding of their relationship contextually. Therefore, the caption is somewhat out of context, as it presents a sensationalized description without addressing the complexities involved.
final_result.additional_notes: The claim of Harris having an "extramarital" affair does have basis within her dating history with Brown, but it's essential to understand the implications of their relationship and the status of Brown's marriage when assessing the accuracy of the term used. The degree to which this is reflected in the context of their political careers is also critical.
